Class Movie

java.lang.Object
dms.model.Movie
public class Movie extends Object
Represents a movie entity in the Movie Manager DMS.

This class acts as a plain data model (POJO) and mirrors the structure of the movies table in the MySQL database. Each field maps directly to a column in the database.

Responsibilities:

  • Encapsulate movie details such as ID, title, director, release year, duration, genre, and rating.
  • Validate data through constructor and setter methods to ensure integrity.
  • Provide basic overrides for equals(Object), hashCode(), and toString().

Author: Luis Augusto Monserratt Alvarado

Version: 1.0

  • Constructor Details

    • Movie

      public Movie(String movieId, String title, String director, int releaseYear, int durationMinutes, String genre, double rating)
      Constructs a new Movie instance with the provided field values.
      Parameters:
      movieId - unique identifier (cannot be null or blank)
      title - movie title (optional; trimmed if non-null)
      director - director's name (optional; trimmed if non-null)
      releaseYear - year the movie was released (1888–2100)
      durationMinutes - duration of the movie in minutes (1–999)
      genre - genre of the movie (trimmed if non-null)
      rating - rating score (0.0–10.0)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if movieId is null or blank
